intro: Kalanchoe pinnata var. genuina, commonly known as the mother of millions, is a succulent plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its fleshy, paddle-shaped leaves that are often covered in a white powdery coating called farina. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers during the spring and summer months. It is highly drought-tolerant and thrives in well-draining soil and full sun. Its unique ability to propagate through plantlets on its leaf edges makes it a popular choice for gardeners and horticulturists.
